NCPTSD Treatment Name: Concurrent Treatment for PTSD and Substance Use Disorder Using Prolonged Exposure (COPE)
Method for Handling Missing Data: multilevel model utilizing robust maximum likelihood, uses all available data
Statistical Analysis Method:
PTSD scores: Random intercept and slope mutilevel models utilizing robust maximum likelihood. Effect sizes as regression coefficients standardized to baseline SD of each outcome in total sample.
Diagnostic change: binary logistic regression
Diagnostic Change Definition 1: CAPS-IV score <50
Trauma Detail (Study level): Combat-related, Rape/sexual assault, Accidents, Community/school violence, Natural or manmade disasters, Terrorism/policital violence/forced displacement; Other (physical assault, assault with a weapon, unwanted or uncomfortable sexual experience, captivity, severe human suffering, sudden violent death of someone close, sudden unexpected death of someone close, other very stressful event or experience)
Citation: Back SE, Killeen T, Badour CL, et al. Concurrent treatment of substance use disorders and PTSD using prolonged exposure: a randomized clinical trial in military veterans. Addict Behav. 2019 Mar;90:369-77. doi: 10.1016/j.addbeh.2018.11.032. PMID: 30529244.

PTSD scores: Random intercept and slope mutilevel models utilizing robust maximum likelihood. Effect sizes as regression coefficients standardized to baseline SD of each outcome in total sample.
Diagnostic change: binary logistic regression
Trauma Detail (Study level): Combat-related, Rape/sexual assault, Accidents, Community/school violence, Natural or manmade disasters, Terrorism/policital violence/forced displacement; Other (physical assault, assault with a weapon, unwanted or uncomfortable sexual experience, captivity, severe human suffering, sudden violent death of someone close, sudden unexpected death of someone close, other very stressful event or experience)
Citation: Back SE, Killeen T, Badour CL, et al. Concurrent treatment of substance use disorders and PTSD using prolonged exposure: a randomized clinical trial in military veterans. Addict Behav. 2019 Mar;90:369-77. doi: 10.1016/j.addbeh.2018.11.032. PMID: 30529244.

Method for Handling Missing Data: study states that missing data were not imputed
Statistical Analysis Method: Bivariate analyses: unpaired 2-tailed t-tests and Pearson chi-squared tests; multivariate analyses: maximum likelihood to estimate beta coefficients and SEs. Continuously specified dependent variables used a normal distribution and identify link; dichotomously specified dependent variables used a binomial distribution and logit link and exponentiated the beta coefficients to obtain odds ratios.
Citation: Fortney JC, Pyne JM, Kimbrell TA, et al. Telemedicine-based collaborative care for posttraumatic stress disorder: a randomized clinical trial. JAMA Psychiatry. 2015 Jan;72(1):58-67. doi: 10.1001/jamapsychiatry.2014.1575. PMID: 25409287.

PTSD Outcome Measure Detail: CAPS total score without sleep item (D-1)

Statistical Analysis Method: Mixed design repeated measures ANOVA with paired t-tests, within-condition effect size using Cohen's d, between-condition effect size calculated as (Brief NET follow-up mean minus baseline mean) - (control follow-up mean minus baseline mean) / standard dviation of pooled change scores

Method for Handling Missing Data: Multiple imputation (100 replicate datasets) using values sampled uniformly between missing at random and LOCF
Statistical Analysis Method: Differences in means; standard regression adjustment for effect modification and random effects to account for intra-participant and intra-therapist measurement correlations

Statistical Analysis Method: ANOVA; ANCOVA; Effect size (standardized mean change) calculated as mean change from week 0 divided by SD of change
Diagnostic Change Definition 1: Not meeting criteria for PTSD according to CAPS-2
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio: ≥2 standard deviations improvement from baseline on total of 3 clusters on CAPS (reexperiencing, avoidance, and arousal)
Additional Defs of Clinically Meaningful: Additional definitions of Clinically Meaningful Response reported in the study
Trauma Detail (Study level): combat-related, rape/sexual assault, accidents, community/school violence, terrorism/political violence/forced displacement

Diagnostic Change Definition 1: Not meeting criteria for PTSD
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio:
Investigators' and patients' subjective impression of improvement and
CAPS score change >15 points and CAPS item #25 <3 and overall CAPS score <50
Trauma Detail (Study level): child sexual abuse, rape/sexual assault, accidents, illness/medical procedure
Citation: Oehen P, Traber R, Widmer V, et al. Method for Handling Missing Data: BOCF for patients who drop out of treatment and were lost to followup. Left missing for patients who were lost to followup but continued treatment. Imputation for patients who completed treatment
Statistical Analysis Method: Mixed-design ANOVA, Cohen's d, and dependent sample t-test for change in mean score, Fisher's exact test for clinically meaningful response
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio: Reliable change index defined as ≥10-point change on CAPS
Citation: Ready DJ, Mascaro N, Wattenberg MS, et al. A controlled study of group-based exposure therapy with Vietnam-era veterans. J Loss Trauma. 2018;23(6):439-57. doi: 10.1080/15325024.2018.1485268. PMID: 133654049.

Publication Treatment Name: Exposure with eyes fixated and moving
Statistical Analysis Method: Linear mixed models with a priori contrasts; Cohen's d effect sizes
Diagnostic Change Definition 1: Not meeting criteria for PTSD according to SCID
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio: 20-point decrease in CAPS score from baseline to posttreatment
Trauma Detail (Study level): accidents, natural or manmade disasters, community/school violence, other (sexual trauma)
Citation: Sack M, Zehl S, Otti A, et al. NCPTSD Treatment Name: Integrated cognitive behavioral therapy for PTSD and AUD
Method for Handling Missing Data: Generalized estimating equations with assumption of data missing at random
Statistical Analysis Method: Linear mixed models with a priori contrasts; Cohen's d effect sizes
Diagnostic Change Definition 1: Not fulfilling DSM-IV criteria for PTSD according to CAPS
Additional Defs of Clinically Meaningful: Additional definitions of Clinically Meaningful Response reported in the study
Trauma Detail (Study level): child physical abuse, child sexual abuse, rape/sexual assault, community/school violence, intimate partner violence, accidents, other ("witnessed injury/killing/mutilation", "news of someone close", "danger of losing life/other")
Citation: Sannibale C, Teesson M, Creamer MC, et al. Randomized controlled trial of cognitive behaviour therapy for comorbid post-traumatic stress disorder and alcohol use disorders. Addiction. 2013 Aug;108(8):1397-410. doi: 10.1111/add.12167. PMID: 25328957.

NCPTSD Treatment Name: Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) + cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) without a trauma focus
Method for Handling Missing Data: missing items on scales replaced by average scores on the observed items if >50% of items were answered; if <50% of items were answered or scale completely missing then score was not imputed.
Statistical Analysis Method: Multilevel analysis with time nested in participants and participants nested in victims; Cohen's d statistics for effect size
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio: IES (Dutch version) score at end of treatment >2 standard deviations below the mean of the baseline sample (IES <23)
Citation: van Denderen M, de Keijser J, Stewart R, et al. Treating complicated grief and posttraumatic stress in homicidally bereaved individuals: a randomized controlled trial. Clin Psychol Psychother. 2018 Feb 26(25):497-508. doi: 10.1002/cpp.2183. PMID: 29479767.

NCPTSD Treatment Name: Imaginal exposure (experimental paradigm) followed by methylene blue
Method for Handling Missing Data: Mixed effects model with missing data treated as ignorable and randomly missing
Statistical Analysis Method: Mixed effects models for continuous outcomes and generalized linear mixed models for binary outcomes, effect size d calculated using on-average difference divided by pooled SD
Diagnostic Change Definition 1: Not meeting criteria for PTSD according to PSS-I
Clinically Meaningful Response Definitio: PSS-I ≤23 and CGI-I ≤3 (determined using RCI cutoff c)
Trauma Detail (Study level): combat-related, child physical abuse, child sexual abuse, rape/sexual assault, accidents, community/school violence, natural or manmade disasters, other (not specified)
Citation: Zoellner LA, Telch M, Foa EB, et al. Enhancing extinction learning in posttraumatic stress disorder with brief daily imaginal exposure and methylene blue: a randomized controlled trial. J Clin Psychiatry. 2017;78(7):e782-e9. doi: 10.4088/JCP.16m10936. PMID: 28686823.
